premise_source_doc_sentence: A Faraday cage operates because an external electrical field causes the electric charges within the cage 's conducting material to be distributed such that they cancel the field 's effect in the cage 's interior .

They are also used to protect people and equipment against actual electric currents such as lightning strikes and electrostatic discharges , since the enclosing cage conducts current around the outside of the enclosed space and none passes through the interior .

There is a corresponding reduction in energy when electromagnetic radiation is red-shifted , as given by Planck 's relation , due to the electromagnetic radiation propagating in opposition to the gravitational gradient .

In physics , electromagnetic radiation  (  EM radiation or EMR  )  refers to the waves  (  or their quanta , photons  )  of the electromagnetic field , propagating  (  radiating  )  through space carrying electromagnetic radiant energy .
Classically , electromagnetic radiation consists of electromagnetic waves , which are synchronized oscillations of electric and magnetic fields that propagate at the speed of light through a vacuum .
